It is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along its slender stems. The plant produces inconspicuous, greenish flowers that are clustered in small umbels, typical of the Ericaceae family. Hylandra suecica thrives in acidic, nutrient-poor soils and is often found in shaded, moist environments.
